column4: why is it fedora installation so big but ubuntu so small as in only 700mb?
why are you even asking such a question ?

well you realize that an OS can come in many flavors, since ubuntu and fedora are both based on linux, you can imagine that many different types of packages could be installed on each OS, which would mean that each OS size could possibly never be the same
further more, each package that is available to fedora is a different package then those for ubuntu as ubuntu is debian based, you install .deb, and fedora is based on red hat, which uses .rpms
